subject: Real Estate
title: The Decoy Effect in Real Estate
description: A quick, practical guide to The Decoy Effect in Real Estate.

hook.text: An agent shows you three homes. The first is too cheap and ugly. The third is too expensive. The second is just right.

buildup.text: The decoy effect uses a clearly inferior option to make the target choice look more attractive by comparison.

discovery.text: Agents often start with a terrible property â€” the decoy â€” to make the next home feel like a bargain.

twist.text: The first home was never meant to sell. It exists only to frame your perception of the second one.

climax.text: Choices are never made in a vacuum. What you're shown first determines what you choose next.

punchline.text: The bad house exists to make the next one look perfect.

quiz.question: What is the decoy effect in real estate showings?
options: Using an inferior option to make the target look better
